intro: Viola palmata var. variabilis, commonly known as the variable violet, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to the eastern United States, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The leaves are typically palmate, with five to seven lobes, and the flowers often have a distinctive yellow throat. It is a perennial herb that plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitat.
